title: 109_hr3988
content:
The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes businesses with a significant presence in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" mandates that a certain percentage of procurement contracts related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita must be awarded to small businesses with a significant presence in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" requires Federal departments to provide opportunities for small businesses to participate in procurement contracts related to Hurricane Katrina and Rita. Compliance with subcontracting goals for small businesses is also mandated, and a report must be submitted to Congress within 2 years of the Act's enactment. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must submit a report to Congress detailing opportunities for small businesses under the Act. This subsection will end one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small business concerns treated as HUBZone for Small Business Act program purposes. Applies during Federal Disaster Declaration period for affected counties as of August 28, 2005. SEC. 4. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. No federal facility can be permanently moved from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area. This restriction expires after two years from the enactment of this Act. Reports must be submitted if a federal facility is temporarily relocated for more than 6 months. The reports required for the temporary relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas include a status report to be submitted within 6 months of the relocation and additional reports every 6 months thereafter. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. (a) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Small Business Concern defined as small businesses in Gulf hurricane-affected areas as of August 28, 2005.
(b) Gulf Hurricane Disaster defined as events caused by Hurricane Katrina or Rita declared major disasters by the President.
(c) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Area defined for the Act's purposes. The Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act defines a "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area" as a county or parish in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Rita. The term "small business concern" is defined under section 3 of the Small Business Act. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act will be effective 10 days after its enactment.
